intro: Mantisalca salmantica, commonly known as the Salamanca mallow, is a flowering plant native to Spain. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with a velvety texture. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Mantisalca salmantica is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
